questions.text: People whose thinking challenges mine (not just agrees) are ...

answers.5: valued — I seek out challenging thinkers
answers.2: rare — most of my circle thinks like me
answers.3: some — a few challenge me occasionally
answers.1: none — I avoid people who disagree

questions.text: Relationships where we discuss ideas, debate, and learn from each other are ...

answers.4: regular — a valued part of key relationships
answers.5: rich — intellectual exchange is woven throughout
answers.1: nonexistent — my relationships don't go there

questions.text: Being wrong in front of intellectual friends is ...

answers.4: safe — the relationship can handle it
answers.5: welcomed — being wrong is how we learn
answers.2: uncomfortable — I try to hide mistakes
answers.1: terrifying — I avoid it at all costs

questions.text: My contribution to others' intellectual growth is ...

answers.4: substantial — I'm a resource for others
answers.1: minimal — I'm mostly on the receiving end

questions.text: My intellectual friendships changing what I believe or how I think is ...

answers.5: profound — these relationships have shaped me
answers.1: not happening — no one has changed my mind
